title: Secure Shopping

description:
Introduction
NextLY is an e-commerce system prepared with new generation programming language technologies, you can easily do e-commerce with NextLY, it makes your work easier with its easy-to-manage and user-friendly interface.


Welcome to the Nextly documentation! Fastest Ecommerce App built with React, NextJS, Node, Express.js Ant Design and Tailwindcss.


Technology

  • Antd: 4.18.5
  • Next.js: 11.1.2
  • React.js: 17.0.2
  • Redux: 4.1.2
  • Tailwind CSS: 2.2.19
  • Express.js: 4.17.1
  • Passport-jwt: 4.0.0
  • Mongoose: 5.11.15
  • Node.js: v16.4.0

Backend Features:

  • Strong Node.js with Express.js
  • Passport.js Authentication
  • Full Role Based API
  • Manage MongoDB with Mongoose
  • Models Structure
  • Route Structure
  • Multer File Uploader

Storefront Features:

  • Complete Authenticationt
  • Async full text search
  • Category based product filtering
  • Brand based product filtering
  • Price based product filtering
  • Quick Checkout page
  • Stripe Payment
  • User Account settings
  • My order
  • Banner Ads
  • React, Next & Tailwind based
  • Ant Design Inputs
  • Separate REST API connected Frontend
  • Next SEO supported
  • SEO friendly url

Admin Features:

  • Staff Full Role based
  • Analytics Dashboard
  • Manage Product
  • Manage Category
  • Manage Product Type
  • Manage Orders
  • Manage Brands
  • Manage Product Variants
  • Manage Home Contents
  • Manage Menu Contents
  • Manage Order Status
  • Manage Customers
  • Manage Cargo
  • Manage Shipping
  • Multi Currency Supported
  • Store Settings
  • Built with React, Next & Tailwind, Ant Design


Supported Platforms For Local Development

  • Compatible Browsers (Firefox, Safari, Chrome, Edge)
  • Server(Node.js 12.13.0 or later)
  • MacOS, Windows, and Linux are supported

Requirements

  • node(14.0 or later)
  • pm2
  • npm
  • editor: Visual Studio Code(recommended)
title: Welcome

description:
We have used monorepo folder structure with Yarn Workspace. In our app we have three different services:

- backend(api)
- admin

- website

Admin Dashboard

  • Next.js
  • Redux
  • Ant Design
  • Tailwindcss

Shop Frontend

  • Next.js
  • Redux
  • Ant Design
  • Tailwindcss
  • LESS

Backend

  • Node.js
  • Espress.js
  • Multer File Upload
  • Mongoose Models
  • Passport.js
title: How It Works

description:
Prerequisites

- Node(12.22.8 or latter)

- pm2

- npm

- nodemon

Getting Started


1. First download the file and Unzip the downloaded file and folder structure you get

2. Open the folder nextly via Visial Studio Code

3. Edit config.js (your domain, your no-reply mail )

// /config.js file

 ....

 API_URL: "https://backend.nextly.shop",
 WEBSITE_URL: "https://nextly.shop",
 IMG_URL: "https://backend.nextly.shop",

 maillerConfig: {
 // host: 'smtp.gmail.com',
 // port: 465,
 // secure: true,
 // tls: { rejectUnauthorized: true },
 service: 'Gmail',
 auth: {
 user: 'noreply-mail@gmail.com',
 pass: 'password'
        }
    },
....

4. edit .env file in backend folder (mongod atlas or download mongodb enterprice) more details

//backend/.env file

ATLAS_URI=mongodb+srv://<user>:<password>@<cluster0.xmmg5.gcp.mongodb.net>/nextly
PASPORTJS_KEY=nextlykey

5. Open Visial Studio Code terminal

6. pm2 and nodemon instal global

sudo npm install -g pm2@latest nodemon

7. All npm package install

sudo npm run allnpmi

8. All Project start developer mode

sudo npm run allnpmdev

9. Add initial Data

Visit link: http://localhost:5000/installdb

10. Ready nextly

backend: http://localhost:5000

website: http://localhost:3000

admin: http://localhost:8000

11. All Next. build (for deployment)

sudo npm run allnpmbuild

12. All Next start and start backend (for deployment)

sudo npm run allnpmstart
title: Getting Started
